abstract: A roundup of vibrant dishes for the new year, from a vegetable-packed green soup to a comforting persimmon porridge.
lead_paragraph: When the trees are bare, the skies are gray and the threat of a cold seems to be eternally looming, there is no better time to rekindle your creative spirit in the kitchen. Winter may be the season of warming soups, stews and porridges, but they needn’t be one-note or soporifically heavy. Below, a roundup of simple and energizing recipes, from the dancer Misty Copeland’s beautifully light flounder dish to the Italian chef Nina Clemente’s bright ginger-laden dal, that will reinvigorate your rotation of cold-weather staples — and help you recover from the holidays.
